- "State of Crypto" (2024): https://a16zcrypto.com/posts/series/state-of-crypto

For zombie blockchains:
- "How to sort zombie blockchains from the living" (2024): https://www.axios.com/2024/05/09/zombie-blockchains-crypto-forbes-report

bio.text: Learn & build with web3 data: https://skool.com/data3

casts.text:
◼️5/100: Block-by-Block

One thing I learned about: The number of blockchains.

I don't know.

- There is no one list of blockchains.
- Private blockchains are, well, private.
- 'Public' in public blockchains does not mean 'globally known'.
- Blockchains can appear/disappear quickly without leaving a record.
- Zombie blockchains: They have been once but maybe not anymore.

🔽🛠️Resources🔽

casts.text:
◼️4/100: Block-by-Block

One thing I learned about: Securing content provenance

Challenge: Data integrity in the age of deepfakes.

Projects like Starling Lab aim to "restore trust in digital media":
- Capture, store, and verify digital content
- Create chains of evidence
- Preserve digital records with cryptography

🔽🛠️Resources🔽

- Starling Lab for Data Integrity (2024) https://starlinglab.org

bio.text: Learn & build with web3 data: https://skool.com/data3

casts.text:
◼️3/100: Block-by-Block

One thing I learned about: Features of Web3 data.

Web3 data has many features I don't see with Web2.

3 main ones:
- Decentralized replication: Data lives on many nodes that don't trust each other.
- Immutability: Once a blockchain is finalized, you cannot update it.
- Transparency: Anyone can read the history of transactions.

🔽🛠️Resources🔽

bio.text: Learn & build with web3 data: https://skool.com/data3

casts.text:
I couldn't find an overall overview of Web3 data types. The following are useful, though:

- "Blockchain Data Deep Dive": https://www.alchemy.com/overviews/blockchain-data
- "On-chain and off-chain data": https://livebook.manning.com/book/blockchain-in-action/chapter-6/
- "What Is Offchain Data and Computation?": https://chain.link/education-hub/off-chain-data

openGraph.description: Exploring different kinds of on-chain data: blocks, transactions, receipts, and state · Defining, emitting, and logging events · Accessing event logs from transaction receipts to support Dapp operations · Designing and developing Dapps with on-chain and off-chain data · Demonstrating on-chain and off-chain data using ASK and blind auction Dapps

bio.text: Learn & build with web3 data: https://skool.com/data3

casts.text:
◼️2/100: Block-by-Block

One thing I learned about: Web3 data can be many things.

And, we can group them in many ways:
1. On-chain vs Off-chain
2. Domain (DeFi, DAO, NFT, DePi, DeSci)
3. Platform (Ethereum, Solidity, Polkadot)
4. Application (Analytics, App development, Machine learning models, Agents)

Many ways to frame it. Many things to learn.

🔽🛠️Resources🔽

bio.text: Learn & build with web3 data: https://skool.com/data3

casts.text:
The following are not about data. They are about Python in Web3. Which is useful for Web3 data:

- "Web3.py learning resources": https://web3py.readthedocs.io/en/stable/resources.html and Snakecharmers blog https://snakecharmers.ethereum.org/
- "Intro to Web3.py": https://www.dappuniversity.com/articles/web3-py-intro 
- PyChain 2022 talks organized by: https://www.pychain.org/agenda

bio.text: Learn & build with web3 data: https://skool.com/data3

casts.text:
◼️1/100: Block-by-Block

One thing I learned about: Web3 data dev resources are few.

Web3 data is niche. Developers have a hard time finding material to learn from.

After days of research, I found these to be the most hands-on:
- Primodata guides: https://primodata.org/guides.
- Kamu Web3 data engineering tutorial: https://kamu.dev/blog/2024-08-28-intro-to-web3-data-engineering/

🔽🛠️Resources🔽

casts.text:
◼️0/100: Block-by-Block

One thing I learned about: Posting helps you learn.

Learning takes time, so I try to do it effectively.

4 things that help:
- Chunk: Break down complex topics into manageable chunks
- Do it regularly: Spacing out helps you with retention
- Write about it: It forces you to understand it better
- Get feedback: You will know if you are wrong fast

I am learning about Web3 Data. I will post here the things I learn in the following days.

🔽🛠️Resources🔽
